reviews.title: The Legend has lost its way!
text: What has happened to the Eagle in Toronto? It has become a shell of its former leather bar scene—belly top clad wanna be twinks facing to techno version of Madonna, men sitting around tables of the patio sipping beer as they watch 80’s series on a big screen tv?  Get us back to Amsterdam and the Black Eagle!  Won’t be returning.

reviews.title: Fab… friendly… welcoming… mix of people… varied… very gay!
text: Amazingly friendly bar. ALL of the sraff were brilliant and the local customers very welcoming.
Toronto has amazed me for how friendly the people are and this is the case in this bar.
They have a variety of themes (‘typical gay themes through to a (random) games night of Mario cart and other such things… it works!)
No matter the type of person you are you are seriously welcomed in!
The security guys (Chris and others) wee so pleasant and also very friendly… while keeping a watchful eye on potential challenging customers before letting them in!
The owner, Frank, was also delightful and very warm to speaking to us foreigners!
Business opportunity, Frank… get to Newcastle in north east England and sort out Eagle out! It needs to be like yours!

reviews.title: Excellent bar! Big shoutout to Chris on Security for being amazing! This is a bar where you will make friends for life.
text: This is my favourite bar in the Village. As a tourist from the U.K., we made to feel welcome, made friends easily, and we loved the vibe. You can be who you want to be here, and that’s great.
The nights are regularly themed, with BBQs in the terrace, naked nights, video game nights, dance nights, and more.
Chris on security is an amazing man. Very friendly, professional and great with customers. The rest of the security team are excellent.
If you want to make friends, this is the bar on the Village. Go there!

reviews.title: So gay so friendly
text: I met the sexiest people soo gay soo friendly. My booty just tingles thinking about going again. So gay so friendly. Mmm

reviews.title: Stranded in Toronto
text: I was stranded in Toronto due to a snow storm while on a business trip.  I went out for the evening.  The management and staff were so friendly at the Black Eagle!  It was a great place to spend the evening!

reviews.title: Gay men’s bar
text: Leather and western bar has been renovated. Has theme nights especially on weekends. Not pretentious.

reviews.title: Men's space
text: The glory days of leather bars are over sadly, but this place does a great job of providing a men's space for the 21st century, without the dress code requirements.  The Sunday afternoon "underwear party" seemed to welcome any kind of dress code from nothing at all to no effort at all, but the atmosphere was fun on the terrace.

We went back for the T dance at 11pm, which featured disco hits from the 80s and 90s and a bunch of blokes living it up on the dance floor like it was 1999. Plenty of action in the dark room later on as well and a good rage of ages represented.  Recommended for a visit.

reviews.title: Trip to the dark fun place
text: Went to the Black Eagle on a night that they were watching RuPaul's Drag Race.  Everyone was quite animated.  There was no coat check, and I didn't realise there was a place to hang up your coat until I was leaving the bar.  Every time I went to get a drink or go to the washroom, I had to ask someone to look after my winter coats.  There is a coat check on Friday and Saturday night.  The place was filled with friendly guys, most in either leather or denim.  There is a dark room on the second floor, also a second bar, and an outside roof terrace.

reviews.title: Make up your mind -- leather bar or not?
text: I dearly miss The Toolbox.  The Black Eagle was a good stop-gap after The Toolbox closed down, but over time the bar has lost its way.  As this is the last self-proclaimed "men's leather bar", they sure don't feel that way most nights.  The last time I stepped in the place, I was shocked they had started to charge a cover -- but even more shocked to discover they rented the entire bar out to a straight organisation, and here I was with a dozen of my friends all dudded up in our leather with NO WHERE TO GO.  This was my final trip to Toronto and I won't be returning, there are no bars/clubs for leather men to go to. You can now find us in Montreal at Aigle Noir (which is barely a step up) but more often in Amsterdam where they still have real leather bars for MEN ONLY with leather dress codes.

All I can recommend to whomever owns the Eagle: Pick a theme and stick with it 100%, you have alienated so many people over the past five years that the brand is now toxic.  If you're a cruise bar, don't play loud music -- stick with the bass & drum at a reasonable volume so people can socialise!!  If you're a dance bar, drop the pretence that you're a leather bar and change your name!!  If you're a leather bar, start enforcing a dress code (at least on Friday/Saturday nights).
In any case, you'll need to advertise what you are because MANY people have written off going out on Church Street at all.

reviews.title: No thanks.
text: Stepped in, looking for a way to cool down and unwind after an emotional therapy appointment.  Popped in quickly, friendly atmosphere, good beer selection, pretty good open on the television. Not bad pricing. Could not get the bar tenders attention to grab a beer for  life of me! Horrible service. Another patron had to get to attention and when I finally got my almost 8$ a bottle he was acting like it was an inconvience that I was ordering. No. Just stop. There are better bars and better bar tenders on the area.

reviews.title: EW...
text: Ew is what comes to mind as you enter the black eagle! Follows by ew ew ew ew ew as  you continue along to the other end of this establishment! This super dark and poorly ventilated bar makes you wish you didn't go out! The people seem to be different too... Oh and to top it off they got super gross porn playing on big screens around the house! Reminded me A lot like the scary dark bars in Berlin
To be fair tho we did go to the black eagle in New York and it was completely a different experience, we had a great time ... Anywho never coming back ...

reviews.title: Interesting experience
text: This gay bar is not with strict dress code even if one could so expect. All kind and age visitors are welcome and staff is very friendly.

reviews.title: Oh - my - god !!!
text: What a HOT bar!!! Black Eagle is a gay bar in Toronto Downtown. Even being a girl, I felt very well received. A enjoyed the ambiance, the atmosphere... It was really hot!!!

reviews.title: The Underwear Party
text: I didn't know that it was a mandatory underwear party, I didn't see the ad and I hardly go to Black Eagle. I came before the party started. About fifteen minutes after the disc jockey began playing the music, one of the staff member approached me in a very rude manner, shouting at me saying it is mandatory to take off my clothes and be in my underwear, it was hard to talk because of the extreme loud music and he questioned me why I'm not buying a drink and I said I usually buy later when I sweat from dancing and he still insists that I should leave, I never experienced such rudeness in my life in going to a club, now how can I recommend this place to my friend?

reviews.title: I’m home again
text: A long-time stalwart of Toronto, the Black Eagle is the premier leather/uniform bar in Toronto. I’ve been coming for years, when I’m in town, and it’s always a little different, but always fun.

I like going to a bar and chatting to people at the bar. That is easy to do here. BE also has something for everyone else - provided you like something a little different, or maybe kinky. Whether it’s pup night, or leather night, or kink night, or naked night, it’s fun. THe patio is something of an institution at the weekends, and its dark room has gone through a few incarnations. But OK if you fancy a little action.
It’s not stress, no sweat. Oh - and when i walked in, there was porn on one TV scree, and Julie Andrews doing showtunes on another. Hats of to the VJ (Frank)!
Need i say more?

reviews.title: Had a great night
text: The Black Eagle was a fun night out.  With themed nights like jockstrap night and naked night it may not be for the faint of heart, but a lot of fun for the more adventurous.  Busy dance floor down stairs.  Nice outside deck, small bar, and dark area upstairs.

reviews.title: Sunday afternoon visit
text: As the bar was charging 5 dollars, then 10 dollars on a Saturday night for entry, I gave it a miss. Far better on a Sunday afternoon. Its clientele were not ALL typical of Eagle bars and certainly friendly. Service was very good; there was a bbq in full swing on the roof garden. I would certainly recommend this

reviews.title: Ultra hip masculine friendly cool design with sexy toilets enroute 2Alain retroSundays man (+ whoa!) man dance. THXHOT!
text: After 4 year absence I was stunned by the impressive bar area, friendly grrrrreat bear staff, cool reveals in the design ... but mostly the lasting statement the superb photography essay on aluminum left me after a beer and butt shake.
The Black Eagle is nothing short of HAWT. YEAHHHHHHHHHH!

reviews.title: Believe the negative reviews
text: What a crappy place. This is actually not a bar for masc men. As a masc in shape late 30's guy I felt completely out of place. The name and reputation are misleading. It is a ridiculously unfriendly bar with so much "attitude"  it almost seems unreal.  The bar staff could not be more unfriendly and unprofessional.  If you are lucky enough to find one who is not camping it up with one of his friends then you might get a drink. What a disappointing negative experience.  The bar caters to a youngish fem crowd. They also charge a hefty cover charge, the place is over crowded with no ventilation.  I could go on but the bottom line is, if you do not fit the right look you are not welcome...and they let you know that from the second you walk through the door.

reviews.title: Wake up!
text: On Halloween weekend of 2016, my domestic partner and I went to Toronto's Black Eagle. Black Eagle Toronto is located in Molly's Bush, Toronto's gay community. Before I describe our negative experience at the Black Eagle, I need to explain the effort we put into celebrating Halloween.

We decided to dress up as ghouls. Between us we spent, $250 on our costumes and makeup. We spent two hours at home trying to make ourselves as ghoulish as possible. Now, we both knew how pathetic and insignificant the gay strip in Toronto has become over the last fifteen years but we decided to make a go of it.

So, there we are at the entrance of the Black Eagle at prime time, Saturday night, Halloween weekend. The door person didn't even greet us in a welcoming, friendly way, he just said, "fifteen bucks each to get in."
I scanned the bar and I noticed there was absolutely no Halloween decorations whatsoever. The place was practically empty. The patrons who were there, were not even wearing costumes.

Now, let's get this straight, I thought to myself. We spent, $250 to dress up in costumes, $30 total to get into the Black Eagle and if we had gone in, we probably would have spent about, $100 on booze. That works out to about 400 bucks, just to have fun. REALLY?

Needless to say, I expressed my discontent with the door person and we left to go to Woody's just up the street. We had to wait in line to get into Woody's but we entered for free, the place was decorated for the Halloween festivities, it was packed, ninety percent of the patrons were in costumes and we had a hoot.

The Black Eagle use to be a down to earth, sexually energized place where normal looking masculine men hung out for fun. However, since the Black Eagle renovated, it has become a stuck up, unfriendly place that caters to the drug induced club circuit scene.
Very few businesses have survived after ignoring its core customers. Wake up!

reviews.title: Fun bar, great guys, crappy DJ
text: I usually like the Eagle. But come on, with this being the last place for bears to dance in Toronto (basically), let's have some
Fun and upbeat music to dance to!

reviews.title: Keep it simple and with an open mind
text: Bears and leather men gather in this downtown Gay bar and welcome you with a significant amount of attitude and with big hearts! Keep an open mind and soon you'll find yourself just at home, whoever you are - leather man or not - bear or not.

reviews.title: Summer Patio
text: I was reading some of the reviews and there is not that many, so I decided to write one. This is a great bar!!  They have renovated it lots. Summer time they have a great patio with full sun. Sunday's in the summer there is a awesome bbq. I have always enjoyed the bbq after finishing some cold pitchers of beer.
We have to remember this is a leather community bar. Dose not mean you have to wear leather when u go.
There are a lot of great special events on weekends. Usually themed. There is some dark corners in the bar for that curious man.
Over all great place and great staff.
Enjoy.
